item.title: Stabilizer Trim/ Rudder Ratio Changer Modules (SRM) – Stabilizer Trim Control

remarks.para: Stabilizer trim control in one module may be inoperative provided:

numlitem.para: Horizontal stabilizer is verified to be operative with the Alternate Stab Trim Switches, and
Rudder ratio control in both modules are operative.

note.para: If Stabilizer Trim control in the other SRM fails, autopilot will not be available.
The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:

numlitem.para: Manual stabilizer trim control is available from either control wheel trim switch. However, stabilizer will move at one-half drive speed.
Autotrim may be affected as follows:

In cruise, if the left SRM stabilizer trim control is inoperative, the left autopilot will not engage because the left FCC will not receive a valid signal from the SRM. Similarly, the right autopilot will not engage if the right SRM trim control is inoperative.

After arming APP mode when autoland status displays LAND 2 or LAND 3, the FCCs ignore the SRM valid signal input, allowing all autopilots to engage. Normal (half-rate) autotrim control is retained by the fully operative SRM.
Speed Stability Trim and Mach Trim are operative.

Inflight failure of the other SRM, or stabilizer trim control in the other SRM, will result in the loss of all autotrim capability and possible loss of all autotrim capability and possible loss of manual trim from both of the control wheel trim switches. Stabilizer trim control may only be available through the Alternate Stabilizer Trim Switches.

The EICAS advisory message >STAB TRIM 2 or >STAB TRIM 3 may remain displayed. Also, the message may be cleared when the stabilizer is moved with the Alternate Stabilizer Trim Switches and reappear when using the control wheel trim switches due to half drive speed stabilizer movement.
Downgrade Aircraft Category Dispatch Status to CAT 2.

placard.para: Placard below Captain’s PFD on P-1-1 panel: "STAB TRIM CONTROL IN L (R) SRM INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

maintenance.para: Deferral of this item requires downgrading to the status indicated in the A/C STATUS DISPATCH column below.

warning.para: ENSURE THAT PERSONNEL AND EQUIPMENT ARE CLEAR OF ALL FLIGHT CONTROL SURFACES.

numlitem.para: Provide electrical power to aircraft and pressurize hydraulic systems 2 and 3.
Check that stabilizer is operative with the Alternate Stabilizer Trim switches:

note.para: During the following tests, the EICAS advisory messages >STAB TRIM 2 and >STAB TRIM 3 will display, along with the status message STAB TRIM. If both advisory messages >STAB TRIM 2 and >STAB TRIM 3 remain displayed at the conclusion of the tests, dispatch is not allowed.

numlitem.para: Ensure stabilizer trim cutout switches and cutout valves operate normally:
Select STAB TRIM 2 CUT OUT and STAB TRIM 3 CUT OUT position on the guarded Stabilizer Trim Cutout Switches located on the control stand.

Using both Alternate Stabilizer Trim Switches located on the control stand, select APL NOSE UP for at least 3 seconds. Monitor stabilizer trim indicator to confirm the stabilizer does not move. If the stabilizer does move, dispatch is not allowed until repairs are made.

Using both Alternate Stabilizer Trim Switches, select APL NOSE DN for at least 3 seconds. Monitor stabilizer trim indicator to confirm the stabilizer does not move. If the stabilizer does move, dispatch is not allowed until repairs are made.
Close the guards on both the STAB TRIM 2 and STAB TRIM 3 Stabilizer Trim Cutout Switches.
Check that no alternate trim solenoid valve is failed in the energized position:

Move the left Alternate Stabilizer Trim Switch in both the aircraft nose up and aircraft nose down directions. Verify the stabilizer does not move. If the stabilizer does move, an arm or control solenoid valve within a STCM (Stabilizer Trim Control Module) is failed in the energized position and dispatch is not allowed until repairs are made.

Move the right Alternate Stabilizer Trim Switch in both the aircraft nose up and aircraft nose down directions. Verify the stabilizer does not move. If the stabilizer does move, an arm or control solenoid valve within a STCM (Stabilizer Trim Control Module) is failed in the energized position and dispatch is not allowed until repairs are made.

note.para: If the EICAS advisory message >STAB TRIM 2 is displayed, perform step D before step C below:

numlitem.para: Ensure stabilizer is operative using Hydraulic System 2 as follows:
Select STAB TRIM 3 CUT OUT position on the guarded Stabilizer Trim Cutout Switch located on the control stand.

Using both Alternate Stabilizer Trim Switches, select APL NOSE UP for at least 3 seconds. Monitor stabilizer trim indicator to confirm motion of stabilizer in aircraft nose up direction. Note that the stabilizer will move at one half drive speed. If the stabilizer does not move, dispatch is not allowed.

Using both Alternate Stabilizer Trim Switches, select APL NOSE DN for at least 3 seconds. Monitor stabilizer trim indicator to confirm motion of stabilizer in aircraft nose down direction. Note that the stabilizer will move at one half drive speed. If the stabilizer does not move, dispatch is not allowed.
Close the guard on the STAB TRIM 3 Stabilizer Trim Cutout Switch.
Ensure stabilizer is operative using Hydraulic System 3 as follows:
Select STAB TRIM 2 CUT OUT position on the guarded Stabilizer Trim Cutout Switch located on the control stand.

Using both Alternate Stabilizer Trim Switches, select APL NOSE UP for at least 3 seconds. Monitor stabilizer trim indicator to confirm motion of stabilizer in aircraft nose up direction. Note that the stabilizer will move at one half drive speed. If the stabilizer does not move, dispatch is not allowed.

Using both Alternate Stabilizer Trim Switches, select APL NOSE DN for at least 3 seconds. Monitor stabilizer trim indicator to confirm motion of stabilizer in aircraft nose down direction. Note that the stabilizer will move at one half drive speed. If the stabilizer does not move, dispatch is not allowed.
Close the guard on the STAB TRIM 2 Stabilizer Trim Cutout Switch.

Dispatch is not allowed with rudder ratio control inoperative in either the left or right SRM. To confirm that rudder ratio control is functioning properly in both modules, verify EICAS status message RUDDER RATIO is not displayed.
